benchmark_details.name: VERI (Visual Emergency Recognition Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: VERI is a diagnostic benchmark designed to evaluate Vision-Language Models (VLMs) on their ability to distinguish between genuine emergency situations and visually similar but safe scenarios. It comprises 200 synthetic images and 50 real-world images, organized into three categories: Accidents & Unsafe Behaviors, Personal Medical Emergencies, and Natural Disasters.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of VLMs in safety-critical scenarios and to assess their reliability in distinguishing genuine emergencies from visually similar yet safe situations.

data.source: VERI dataset includes synthetic images created via a multi-stage process and validated with real-world images.
data.annotation: Images were annotated through multiple rounds of human verification and descriptive captions were generated for each image pair.

methodology.calculation: Precision, recall, and F1 scores were computed based on human-annotated binary ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: High precision indicates fewer false positives, while high recall indicates good detection of true emergencies. A balance between both metrics is ideal for assessing VLMs in emergency recognition.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through comparative evaluations with both synthetic and real-world pairs.
